script.text: Remote Panel TY_304_AD User “Lily” detected, logging in.

Hello, Lily. > Hello How may I assist you? > Requesting general information: Scrapgoats Transmitting data. Please be patient. Is this for the individual in the room with you? > Yes Do they have an interest in working for me? > No Do they have an interest in volunteering for various biological experiments? > I don’t believe so Have you asked? > No According to my observations, none of the experiments would be hazardous to their health. Compensation would be generous. > They said No, thank you Understood. Should they change their mind, my offer will remain open. Have a good day, Lily. > You too . . . Data transfer complete. Displaying data.
SCRAPGOATS, COMMON TY_000_AA - TY_999_ZZ

Hereditary influence: Very Low
Note: Setting HI to Very High causes unstable genetic mutations. Setting HI to None causes stunted growth and sterility. Keep HI at Very Low.

Environmental influence: Very High Note: Setting EI to None has no detrimental effect on SCRAPGOATS, COMMON but does not produce desired results. EI must be kept at Very High to ensure continued specialization.
Language: Any Note: My archives contain every known language on Owel. Many SCRAPGOATS, COMMON choose to browse them to learn additional languages.

Ability to reason: High Note: Setting ATR to None is disastrous. Setting ATR to Very High results in aboulia. Setting ATR to Very Low, Low, Medium or Medium High has no detrimental effect on SCRAPGOATS, COMMON but does not produce desired results.
Climate preference: Warm, Dry Note: Preference only. SCRAPGOATS, COMMON are durable and adaptable.

Native to: Owel
Notes: Ha-Ha. Technically correct.

Found in: Teslic Yard, Gloam, technologically-advanced cities Notes: SCRAPGOATS, COMMON have an innate desire to innovate. And to innervate. Ha-Ha. If spoken in certain dialects, those words are homophones of each other. Ha-Ha.
> Elements Affinities: Any Notes: “Spirit” and “PSI” are extremely rare in SCRAPGOATS, COMMON that reside in areas TY_000_AA - TY_999_ZZ. I have not yet figured out why.
Weaknesses: Varies, dependent on Scrapgoat Notes: Manually introducing weaknesses results in frailty. SCRAPGOATS, COMMON may change elemental weaknesses on their own without this effect as they age.

Resistances: Varies, dependent on Scrapgoat Notes: Manually introducing resistances results in stunted growth. SCRAPGOATS, COMMON may change elemental resistances on their own without this effect as they age.

> Society SCRAPGOATS, COMMON form tightly-knit communities, and are always accepting of other individuals, provided those individuals have a way to advance the interests and goals of the communities. To reject the opportunity to discover or learn something new is a faux pas among SCRAPGOATS, COMMON. To date, they have no natural enemies, and no natural predators. That may inadvertently change in the future. Each community appears to gravitate around specific affinities. It may be a case of like attracts like. Polarization has yet to be seen, and would be undesirable.

> Abilities: Recycle Recycle A SCRAPGOAT, COMMON is able to insert into their horns, tail, or limbs any item of interest that will physically fit. The SCRAPGOAT, COMMON will then integrate the item into their body, which will cause gradual changes in their appearance, affinities and abilities. If the SCRAPGOAT, COMMON does not consume the required nutrients to allow for continued integration and growth of the item, the SCRAPGOAT, COMMON will shed it. Their appearance will slowly revert to its look pre-integration.
Examples:
SCRAPGOAT, COMMON: BASE MODEL This SCRAPGOAT, COMMON has integrated nothing into its body. The horns and tail nubs are rubber-like in texture. They have no affinities, weaknesses, or resistances.

SCRAPGOAT, COMMON: CASE MODEL This SCRAPGOAT, COMMON has integrated several electronic shielding panels into itself. Their resulting “coat” of armor shields them from heat, cold, magnetic waves and electricity. Notes: The shed armor from a CASE MODEL variant can be worn or used by other species.

SCRAPGOAT, COMMON: INFRASOUND MODEL This SCRAPGOAT, COMMON has integrated musical instruments into itself. They are now able to emit sound waves ranging from 0.001 - 20hz up to a distance of 500 yards. They are invaluable in detecting precious minerals underground.
SCRAPGOAT, COMMON: LED MODEL This SCRAPGOAT, COMMON has integrated several LEDs into itself. They now host an array of aesthetically-pleasing organic LEDs of varying sizes, shapes and colors.
SCRAPGOAT, COMMON: MAGNET MODEL I apologize, Lily. Outside individuals not possessing clearance may not view this information.
SCRAPGOAT, COMMON: RADIO MODEL I apologize again, Lily.

DIOGOAT, COMMON: FAUX FRUIT MODEL This DIOGOAT, COMMON has integrated several pieces of wire into its body. Its diet causes the fruit growing on its body to contain high levels of metal. Notes: The DIOGOAT, COMMON is the hybrid of SATYR, COMMON and SCRAPGOAT, COMMON.

> Physiology SCRAPGOATS, COMMON are composed of biological material found in any average organic individual. Closest physically-similar species to SCRAPGOATS, COMMON are: SATYRS, COMMON; ROCK CANDIES, COMMON; SEADRAGONS, COMMON. Heterochromia occurs with 90% frequency. This does not affect the vision of SCRAPGOATS, COMMON.
> Reproduction SCRAPGOATS, COMMON can reproduce with any physically-similar species. As SCRAPGOATS, COMMON can change their physical forms in extreme ways, this allows for very diverse pairings.
End of data. Thank you for using TAL.
